speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: For the past six years, my sweetheart, Ann, and I have lived in Texas near the Gulf Coast, where some of the largest hurricanes have struck the United States, leaving behind tremendous destruction and even loss of life. Sadly enough, recent months have been no stranger to such devastating events. Our love and prayers extend to all who have been impacted in any way. In 2017 we personally experienced Hurricane Harvey, which dropped record rainfall of up to 60 inches (150 cm).

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Natural laws govern the formation of hurricanes. The ocean temperature must be at least 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees C), extending to 165 feet (50 m) below the ocean’s surface. As wind meets the warm ocean water, it causes the water to vaporize and rise into the atmosphere, where it liquifies. Clouds then form, and winds produce a spiral pattern over the ocean’s surface.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Hurricanes are colossal in size, reaching 50,000 feet (15,240 m) or more into the atmosphere and spanning at least 125 miles (200 km) across. Interestingly, as hurricanes meet land, they begin to weaken because they are no longer above the warm waters required to fuel their strength. 1

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: You may never face a devastating physical hurricane. However, each of us has weathered and will weather spiritual hurricanes that threaten our peace and try our faith. In today’s world, they seem to be increasing in frequency and intensity. Thankfully, the Lord has provided us a sure way to joyfully overcome them. By living the gospel of Jesus Christ, we are assured that “when dark clouds of trouble hang o’er us and threaten our peace to destroy, there is hope smiling brightly before us.” 2

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: President Russell M. Nelson explained:

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “Saints can be happy under every circumstance. We can feel joy even while having a bad day, a bad week, or even a bad year!

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “… The joy we feel has little to do with the circumstances of our lives and everything to do with the focus of our lives.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “When the focus of our lives is on … Jesus Christ and His gospel, we can feel joy regardless of what is happening—or not happening﻿—in our lives.” 3

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Just as natural laws govern physical hurricanes, divine laws govern how to feel joy during our spiritual hurricanes. The joy or misery we feel as we brave the storms of life is tied to the laws that God has set. President Nelson has shared, “They’re called commandments, but they are just as true as the law of lift, the law of gravity, [and] the law that governs the heartbeat.”

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: President Nelson continued, “It becomes a rather simple formula: If you want to be happy, keep the commandments.” 4

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Doubt is an enemy of faith and joy. Just as warm ocean water is the breeding ground for hurricanes, doubt is the breeding ground for spiritual hurricanes. Just as belief is a choice, so is doubt. When we choose to doubt, we choose to be acted upon, yielding power to the adversary, thereby leaving us weak and vulnerable. 5

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Satan seeks to lead us to the breeding ground of doubt. He seeks to harden our hearts so that we will not believe. 6 The breeding ground of doubt can appear inviting because its seemingly peaceful, warm waters do not require us to “live by every word that proceedeth forth from the mouth of God.” 7 In such waters Satan tempts us to relax our spiritual vigilance. That inattention can induce a lack of spiritual conviction, where we are “neither cold nor hot.” 8 If we are not anchored on Christ, doubt and its allures will lead us away to apathy, where we shall find neither miracles, lasting happiness, nor “rest unto [our] souls.” 9

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Just as hurricanes weaken over land, doubt is replaced with faith as we build our foundation on Christ. We are then able to see spiritual hurricanes in their proper perspective, and our capacity to overcome them is enlarged. Then, “when the devil shall send forth his mighty winds, yea, his shafts in the whirlwind, … it shall have no power … to drag [us] down to the gulf of misery and endless wo, because of the rock upon which [we] are built, which is a sure foundation.” 10

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: President Nelson has taught:

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “Faith in Jesus Christ is the foundation of all belief and the conduit of divine power. …

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “The Lord does not require perfect faith for us to have access to His perfect power. But He does ask us to believe.” 11

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Since April general conference, my family and I have been seeking to strengthen our faith in Jesus Christ and His Atonement to help us “turn [our] challenges into unparalleled growth and opportunity.” 12

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Our granddaughter Ruby has been blessed with a strong, take-charge will. When she was born, her esophagus was not attached to her stomach. Even as an infant, Ruby, with her parents’ help, met this trial with unusual determination. Ruby is now five years old. Though she is still very young, she is a powerful example of not letting her circumstances determine her happiness. She is always happy.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Last May, Ruby faced an additional hurricane in her life with faith. She was also born with less than a fully developed hand that needed reconstructive surgery. Prior to this rather complex operation, we visited with her and gave her a drawing that beautifully depicts a child’s hand warmly holding the hand of the Savior. When we asked her if she was nervous, she replied, “No, I am happy!”

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Then we asked her, “Ruby, how is that so?”

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Ruby confidently asserted, “Because I know that Jesus will hold my hand.”

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Ruby’s recovery has been miraculous, and she continues to be happy. How the purity of a child’s faith contrasts with the foolishness of doubt that can frequently tempt us as we get older! 13 But we can all become as little children and choose to put aside our unbelief. It is a simple choice.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: A caring father diligently pleaded with the Savior, saying, “If thou canst do any thing, … help us.” 14

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Jesus then said unto him:

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “And straightway the father … cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.” 15

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: This humble father wisely chose to trust his belief in Christ rather than his doubt. President Nelson shared, “Only your unbelief will keep God from blessing you with miracles to move the mountains in your life.” 16

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: How merciful is our God to place the bar for us at the level of believing and not at the level of knowing!

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Alma teaches:

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “Blessed is he that believeth in the word of God.” 17

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: “[For] God is merciful unto all who believe on his name; therefore he desireth, in the first place, that ye should believe.” 18

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Yes, in the first place, God desires that we believe in Him.

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: We face our spiritual hurricanes best by believing in Christ and keeping His commandments. Our belief and obedience link us to power beyond our own to overcome “[whatever] is happening—or not happening﻿—in our lives.” 19 Yes, God “doth immediately bless [us]” for believing and obeying. 20 In fact, over time our state of being changes to happiness, and “we are made alive in Christ” as we exercise our faith in Him and keep His commandments. 21

speaker: Elder Sean Douglas
title: Facing Our Spiritual Hurricanes by Believing in Christ
paragraph_text: Brothers and sisters, may we choose today to “doubt not, but be believing.” 22 “The right way is to believe in Christ.” 23 We are “graven … upon the palms of [His] hands.” 24 He is our Savior and Redeemer, who stands at our very door and knocks. 25 In the name of Jesus Christ, amen.
